alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 7:35AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Wolf River near Rossville For the Wolf River...including Rossville, Germantown...Minor flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wolf River near Rossville. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Small creeks that flow into the Wolf River will begin to back up. Flooding will begin near the Wolf River north of Piperton and north of Collierville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CST Thursday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 11.9 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
